meanings.definition: To foul something with waste or dirt.
meanings.sent1: The naughty dog fowled the clean carpet with mud.
meanings.sent2: Please do not fowl the pristine river with trash.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon fowled the picnic area with food scraps.
meanings.sent4: The storm fowled the streets with fallen leaves.
meanings.sent5: The careless camper fowled the campsite with garbage bags.

meanings.definition: To become fouled with waste or dirt.
meanings.sent1: The pond fowled after the heavy rain washed debris into it.
meanings.sent2: The bathtub fowled quickly when the drain got clogged.
meanings.sent3: The playground fowled with mud after the children played in the rain.
meanings.sent4: The air fowled with smoke from the nearby factory.
meanings.sent5: The river fowled as pollution entered its waters.
